q: The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting.
h:
“The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.
h:
“When you win, say nothing, when you lose say less.” —
Wayne Gretzky

q: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.
h:
“Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.” —
Ralph Marston

q: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.
h:
“You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say. ” —
Martin Luther

q: The mind that turns ever outward Will have no end to craving. Only the mind turned inward Will find a still-point of peace.
h:
“The mind that turns ever outward Will have no end to craving. Only the mind turned inward Will find a still-point of peace.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.
h:
“We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.” —
Barack Obama

q: Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong.
h:
“Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong.” —
Unknown

q: It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.
h:
“It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.” —
Alan Watts

q: The purpose of life is to contribute in some way to making things better.
h:
“The purpose of life is to contribute in some way to making things better.” —
Robert F. Kennedy

q: He who hesitates is a damned fool.
h:
“He who hesitates is a damned fool.” —
Mae West

q: Life is too important to be taken seriously.
h:
“Life is too important to be taken seriously.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Don't let your mind stop you.
h:
“Don't let your mind stop you.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.
h:
“Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.” —
Buddha

q: Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.
h:
“Identification with our mind causes thought to become compulsive.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.
h:
“Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.” —
Buddha

q: Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.
h:
“Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Fear is your worst enemy. Risk is your best friend.
h:
“Fear is your worst enemy. Risk is your best friend.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
h:
“A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer. ” —
Bruce Lee

q: Wit is educated insolence.
h:
“Wit is educated insolence.” —
Aristotle

q: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
h:
“If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.” —
Alexander Pope

q: Today I begin a new life. I will greet this day with love in my heart.
h:
“Today I begin a new life. I will greet this day with love in my heart.” —
Og Mandino

q: Where you are right now doesn't have to determine where you'll end up.
h:
“Where you are right now doesn't have to determine where you'll end up.” —
Barack Obama

q: Heart is what separates the good from the great.
h:
“Heart is what separates the good from the great.” —
Michael Jordan

q: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
h:
“Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Only when I fall do I get up again.
h:
“Only when I fall do I get up again.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
h:
“Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.
h:
“Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.” —
William James

q: It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.
h:
“It is amazing what you can accomplish if you do not care who gets the credit.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: It's necessary to get the losers out of your life if you want to live your dream.
h:
“It's necessary to get the losers out of your life if you want to live your dream.” —
Les Brown

q: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
h:
“In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.
h:
“Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Don't let the past steal your present.
h:
“Don't let the past steal your present.” —
Cherralea Morgen

q: All I can do is be me, whoever that is.
h:
“All I can do is be me, whoever that is.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Don't bother people for help without first trying to solve the problem yourself.
h:
“Don't bother people for help without first trying to solve the problem yourself.” —
Colin Powell

q: Stay away from people who makes you feel like you are wasting their time.
h:
“Stay away from people who makes you feel like you are wasting their time.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
h:
“The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.
h:
“A wise person should have money in their head, but not in their heart.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.
h:
“There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.” —
Huang Po

q: A man is literally what he thinks.
h:
“A man is literally what he thinks.” —
James Allen

q: The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.
h:
“The only normal people are the ones you don't know very well.” —
Alfred Adler

q: Believe you can and you will be halfway there.
h:
“Believe you can and you will be halfway there.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: There is peace even in the storm.
h:
“There is peace even in the storm.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission.
h:
“Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.
h:
“You purchase pain with all that joy can give and die of nothing but a rage to live.” —
Alexander Pope

q: How you think is as important as as what you think.
h:
“How you think is as important as as what you think.” —
Unknown

q: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.
h:
“Where there is no struggle, there is no strength. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.
h:
“You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
h:
“Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: Remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.
h:
“Remember to look up at the stars and not down at your feet.” —
Stephen Hawking

q: Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.
h:
“Be as simple as you can be; you will be astonished to see how uncomplicated and happy your life can become.” —
Paramahansa Yogananda
